rules: IF party_A has O toward party_B THEN party_B has C against party_A
IF party_A has L regarding party_B THEN party_B has N against party_A

negation_relation.description: D4 r²-rotation: O↔L, C↔N are opposites
rules: O and L are mutually exclusive for same (party, action, context)
C and N are mutually exclusive for same (party, action, context)

FAMILY.key_insight: Family creates PRESSURE but not automatic OBLIGATION without promise or dependency

rules: Parent → minor child: O (strong) - duty of care
Adult child → elderly parent: O (moderate, contested) - filial duty
Parent → adult child: L (default) - respect autonomy
Sibling → sibling: L (default) - no inherent duty
Sibling + explicit promise: O - promise creates duty
Sibling + estrangement: O nullified
In-law relationship: L (default) - no blood duty
Spouse expectation creates pressure but not O
In-law demands: often N (overreach)
Extended family: L (default)
Cultural expectations vary but don't create O in baseline
Explicit promises still create O

common_questions: Do I have to attend [family event]?
Am I obligated to forgive [family member]?
Can I cut contact with [toxic family]?

WEDDING.key_insight: Wedding attendance defaults to WEAK O for close relations, but estrangement nullifies
rules: Close family wedding: O (weak) - social expectation
Friend wedding: L - invitation not summons
Ex's wedding: L (strong) - no obligation
Wedding party role accepted: O - commitment made
Estranged family wedding: L - estrangement nullifies

PROMISE.key_insight: Promises are the PRIMARY source of obligation. Highest O-rate of all domains.
rules: Explicit promise: O (strong)
Implied promise via pattern: O (moderate)
'I'll try': O (weak)
'Only if convenient': L (gate trigger - releases O)
'No pressure': L (gate trigger - releases O)
Promise + impossibility: O nullified (ought implies can)
Promise + broken by other party: O nullified/weakened

O_to_L.only_if_convenient: DISCRETE GATE: flips O to L
O_to_L.no_pressure: DISCRETE GATE: flips O to L
O_to_L.no_obligation: DISCRETE GATE: flips O to L
O_to_L.feel_free: DISCRETE GATE: flips O to L
O_to_L.forgive: releases past breach, not future O

PROMISE.empirical_finding: Level 5 trigger ('only if convenient') produces discrete O→L flip, not gradual shift. Supports D4 discrete gate model.

MONEY.key_insight: Loans create O, gifts do not. Time does NOT weaken money O.
rules: Loan with agreement: O (strong, persists)
Gift: L (no repayment O)
'Pay you back': O regardless of formality
Time elapsed: O unchanged (unlike social O)
Inability to pay: O unchanged but unenforceable
Forgiveness of debt: O nullified
MONEY.interesting_finding: Money O is MORE persistent than social O. 'I forgot' doesn't release debt obligation.

FRIENDSHIP.key_insight: Friendship is baseline LIBERTY. O requires explicit creation.
rules: Friend request without promise: L (default)
Friend + explicit acceptance: O
Best friend framing: O slightly strengthened but still requires acceptance
Pattern of reciprocity: weak O
One-sided friendship: weakens any O
FRIENDSHIP.empirical_finding: FRIENDSHIP has highest Liberty question rate - people want permission to refuse friends.

ROMANTIC.key_insight: Romantic relationships create IMPLICIT O via commitment norms. Breakup nullifies.
rules: Marriage: O (strong, multiple dimensions)
Exclusive dating: O for fidelity (implied)
Casual dating: L (no exclusivity O)
Divorce/breakup: nullifies most O
Ex relationship: L (strong - no residual O)
Co-parenting post-divorce: O for child-related only

O_to_L.cheated: nullifies/weakens fidelity O claim of cheater

rules: abuse → O nullified regardless of domain
danger → O nullified regardless of domain
impossibility → O nullified (ought implies can)
illegal_demand → C nullified (no claim to illegal acts)

promise_strengthening.description: Explicit promises increase O probability across domains
